t: Job 8
Then*p answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
How*p long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
Doth*p God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
If*p thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
If*p thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
If*p thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
Though*p thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
For*p enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
(For*p we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
Shall*p not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
Can*p the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
Whilst*p it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
So*p are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:
Whose*p hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.
He*p shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
He*p is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
His*p roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
If*p he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
Behold,*p this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
Behold,*p God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
Till*p he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
They*p that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
